abstract: Demonstrations break out across Pakistan against French satirical newspaper Charlie Hedbo after it published cartoons of Prophet Muhammad, enraging Muslims for whom any visual depiction of Muhammad is forbidden; protesters and police clash outside French Consulate in Karachi, leaving four people with gunshot wounds.
lead_paragraph: Clashes between the police and protesters in Karachi left four people, two of them journalists, with gunshot wounds as protests erupted across Pakistan against the French satirical newspaper.

byline.contributor: Zia ur-Rehman reported from Karachi, and Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan. Declan Walsh contributed reporting from London.
byline.original: By ZIA ur-REHMAN and SALMAN MASOOD

snippet: Clashes between the police and protesters in Karachi left four people, two of them journalists, with gunshot wounds as protests erupted across Pakistan against the French satirical newspaper.

headline.main: Anger at Charlie Hebdo Turns Violent in Pakistan
headline.print_headline: Anger at Charlie Hebdo Turns Violent in Pakistan
